The Window Object¶

The window object will show up to your scripts as window once it has been initialised.

It is not stored as a property of world, but instead if spliced in using the world.environment dictionary.

There are a host of useful shortcut keys, or accelerators bound to the window. You can easily override these with successive calls to AddAccelerator, in the form:

window.AddAccelerator(modifiers, key, function)

Unlike the standard wx Frame, MMC’s window object will happily modify accelerators on the fly.

Warning!!!¶

Buggy code can leave you unable to connect to your world, so be warey when manipulating this object.

The Window API¶

The gui part of the worlds framework.

class gui.worldframe.EntryCtrl(*args, **kwargs)¶

The text control used for the entry line.

Insert(text, pos=None, track=True)¶

Insert text at position pos. Move insertion point if track == True, and insertion point >= insertion point.

class gui.worldframe.OutputCtrl(*args, **kwargs)¶

The text control used for the output window.

class gui.worldframe.WorldFrame(filename=None)¶

Main window object.

SetTitle(value)¶

Adds the application name to title.

addAlias(event=None)¶

The GUI front end to world.World.addAlias().

addTrigger(event=None)¶

The GUI front end for world.World.addTrigger().

adjustVolume(amount=1.0)¶

Adjust the output volume by small amounts.

editAliases(event=None)¶

Edit aliases in a GUI.

editTriggers(event=None)¶

Edit triggers in a GUI.

init()¶

Add a world to the window, and get it ready for action.

keyParser(event)¶

Process any keys pressed while the entry line has focused.

new(event=None)¶

Creates a new window and world combination.

onClose(event)¶

Code to be run before the window is closed for good.

onEnter(event=None, clear=True)¶

Enter was pressed, handle commands from the entry line.

onHelp(event=None)¶

Displays HTML help.

onSendFile(event=None)¶

Send a file to the world.

open(event=None, path='')¶

Open a new world.

openWorld(event=None)¶

Open the world’s connection. Do it in a new thread so it doesn’t block.

outputHook(event)¶

Move the user to the entry line, and have whatever key they pressed added to their command.

save(event=None)¶

Save the current world.

saveAs(event=None)¶

Save the current world under a new name.

selectOutput(event=None)¶

Selects a new audio output.

speakLine(pos=None)¶

Speak lines provided by world.World.getOutput().

updateFunc(world, section, option, value)¶

Acts as the callback for world-options.

To add more instructions, add them to the updateInstructions dictionary on this window. For example:

self.updateInstructions[‘world’][‘name’] = lambda value: self.SetTitle(value)
